intro: Myrmecodia schlechteri subsp. eraveensis, commonly known as the Eraveensis Cephalopod. This unique plant is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, swollen, honeycomb-like stems. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in Indonesia. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with ants, which reside in the hollow chambers within its stems. Its botanical features include small, clustered flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves that are adapted to its humid, shaded habitat.
